story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled at the foot of a great mountain, there lived a kind and wise Buddhist monk named Thich Nhat Hanh. He was known throughout the land for his gentle nature and the peaceful energy that surrounded him.

One day, a young boy named Liam came to visit the monk. Liam had been having trouble sleeping at night, as his mind was always filled with thoughts and worries. Thich Nhat Hanh listened carefully to Liam's concerns and then said, "Liam, I have a story that I think will help you find peace at bedtime."

Liam settled down on a cushion beside the monk and listened intently as Thich Nhat Hanh began to speak.

"Long ago, in a faraway land, there was a beautiful garden filled with all manner of flowers, trees, and bushes. This garden was tended by an old gardener who had spent his entire life nurturing its growth. He knew each plant by name, and cared for them as if they were his own children.

One day, as the sun began to set, the gardener would walk through the garden and gently say to the plants, 'Goodnight, my dear ones. May you rest in peace and tranquility through the night, and awaken refreshed and rejuvenated in the morning.'

The garden flourished under the care of the old gardener, and the flowers bloomed more brightly and fragrantly than any others in the world.

One night, as the gardener was making his evening rounds, he came across a small sapling that had just recently been planted. The sapling was still young and fragile, and had not yet grown strong enough to withstand the elements.

The old gardener looked at the tiny plant and said, 'Goodnight, little one. May you find the strength to grow, and the resilience to weather any storm.'

As the gardener continued on his way, a gentle breeze began to blow through the garden, and the rustling leaves seemed to carry the old gardener's words to all the plants in the garden.

'Goodnight, my dear ones. May you rest in peace and tranquility through the night, and awaken refreshed and rejuvenated in the morning.'

And so, the garden slept, and when the sun rose the next morning, all the plants had heard the old gardener's words and taken them to heart.

From that night on, whenever Liam had trouble sleeping, he would remember the story of the garden and the old gardener's words. He would imagine himself as a small sapling in that peaceful garden, and soon, his worries would fade away, and he would drift off to sleep, surrounded by a sense of peace and tranquility.

And that, dear Liam, is how you too can find peace at bedtime."

Thich Nhat Hanh smiled at Liam, who returned the smile, feeling a warmth in his heart. From that night on, Liam never had trouble sleeping again, and he carried the story of the garden and the old gardener's words with him always.

And so, Liam and his family lived happily, spreading kindness and peace throughout the village.

The end.
